page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: The large proportion of the land covered by this survey area is farmland, so farming remains an important aspect of life, although only a very small number of people are now engaged in it. The land is mainly Limestone Brash. Most of the land is used for growing barley, wheat and oilseed rape. Some maize is also grown. Although cattle (for beef), and sheep are seen on pasture most livestock are kept in barns, and food brought to them. Sheep graze the grassed area of the Base below the communications antennae. There is very little land that is wild, but there are odd copses for the attraction of game birds and the setting of pheasants ready for the shooting season. Most pasture is land too wet to plough because of the abundance of springs.
